rComments: Crystal clear lectures always touching upon real world applications which serves as a great motivation to dive deeper into the subject. Making linear algebra interesting is not easy!

Gabe recorded his classes and office hours, live AV included. One of the best classes I'd taken at that point due to that. I struggled with the algebra and background math, but the class and prof were so outstanding, that I ended up learning a lot! The hard work really paid off. Gabe was very patient with emails and office hours for all students.

This class was absolutely fantastic. The TA's were incredibly helpful, and If you showed up to office hours or re-watched a lecture, you would have a solid understanding of what to do. But the class requires a lot of trial and error. Mostly Error. Good luck!

LOVE Gabe, it is truly an honor to know him and have been his student. The class is often claimed to be the most difficult and time consuming at UCSC, but every minute is worth it and you will miss it when it's gone. Gabe is a fantastically smart and compassionate man who will get to know you very well. He genuinely  cares about his students.
This is a very hard class.

All tutors for this class are expected to work 5hr+ over their maximum paid time and they pull all-nighter's with students when crunching for the final project last two weeks. This class is 95% lab 5% lecture, you MUST go in expecting 100+hrs/week or you are destined to get a B or fail. >30% drop by week 1 always, be ready to hit lab @full sprint.
Very good professor, posts on the class forums.
He's a Boss in a great way. If you work, you get a good grade, you slack, you fail.. It's that easy.

This class was difficult and time consuming but a blast. Professor Elkaim was very help full and was available to answer questions almost any time of the day and night. He even would hang out in the lab sometime until 2am.  He also had some nice stories. I don√¢??t think this class would even work with any other teacher.

Very time consuming class but you are going to enjoy every moment of it! He is very helpful and easy to approach. You will see him at weird times (1-2am)coming to the lab to assist you. Very respectful. Lectures are crystal clear and he posts it online. I am not an overachiever student but for the first time I enjoyed doing school work! Take him!

Elkaim is one of the most dedicated professors i've had at ucsc. The class itself is very difficult, but he offers help to students at all times of the day (literally). Building a robot is no easy task.

Gabe Elkaim is my favorite professor ever.  He was so dedicated to our learning experience.  He would stay up until 2am to help us on our projects.  Yet, we still had to stay up all night after that to finish them.

First, have no misconceptions about 118. To pass the class you will be spending all night in lab, probably once a week or more even if you think you're bright enough to avoid it. Second, you will love spending all night in lab. This class teaches such a huge amount of "real" engineering it's impossible to review here, but it's worth taking, 100%.

I was interested in this class from the description of the class. After taking it, I realized it was nothing like the description. In class he just talked about pendulums all day, and never really made sense how it related to section. His tests were also NOTHING like the practice tests.

Elkaim is a great teacher. At first I didnt like him, but it turned out he was just weeding students out. He is clear, helpful, puts in alot of effort into the class and is very helpful. Just be sure to go to office hours.

Consider this professor as the typical style of UCSC SOE style -- you learn if you want to. Lecture and Labs are never mandatory, but you will need to go. Concept is not too much to understand but work load is huge. Elkaim's teaching style: Let you explore before he actually teach you the concept.

I thought Gabe's teaching was great.  He is a bit of a megalomaniac, but his explanations and lectures are clear, entertaining and paced properly (i.e. his lectures seem easy, but at the end of the class you realize you've covered a lot of material and understand it well).

He's very sensible to students' concerns but the class itself moves rather fast. The labs aren't that hard but you can't afford to fall behind. Most of the lab help would come from TAs who are more trained in the Assembly languaged used for the assignments.

Your grade in this class is based on how well you can do binary arithmetic and **** essay question answers.  The lectures are pointless basic explanations of things you had to know weeks ago for an assignment.  You may learn assembly in this class, but it wont be from him.  Avoid!

Very enthusiastic about the material, and as a result, his engaged demeanor makes it easy to pay attention and appreciate the material. However, other reviewers are correct when they say the class is out of sync with the lab. The tests were difficult but generously curved; no complaints there.

Elkaim doesn't know much about the assembly languages taught in this class leaving the TA's fully responsible for teaching the languages.  Elkaim's lectures are way behind the homework and lab assignments and are all recycled powerpoint presentations.  Suicide midterm and final.  AVOID!

The assignments for this class took a long time, especially for the lab section. Most labs took about 6-8 hours for me. The professor was very approachable for help and a plethora of notes and such were present online. The midterms/finals are very tedious
